briefTitle: Assessment of Intranasal Glucagon in Children and Adolescents With Type 1 Diabetes
officialTitle: Assessment of Intranasal Glucagon in Children and Adolescents With Type 1 Diabetes
summary: The purpose of this study was to assess how glucagon administered nasally, using a nasal dosing delivery device, works in children and adolescents compared with commercially-available glucagon given by injection. In addition, the safety and tolerability of glucagon given nasally was evaluated.

primaryOutcome.measure: Maximum Change From Baseline Concentration (Cmax) of Glucagon
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Pre-dose; 5, 10, 15, 20, 30, 40, 60 and 90 minutes following glucagon administration

4 to<8 Years Old NG Visit 2.0 mg
4 to<8 Years Old NG Visit 3.0 mg
